dcterms:description: The dataset comprises firms listed in the US between January 2000 and June 2020 downloaded from Bloomberg. The data that support the findings of this study are available from Bloomberg LP. Restrictions apply to the availability of these data, which were used under license for this study. Data are however available from the authors upon reasonable request and with permission of Bloomberg LP.
dcterms:title: Large dataset of US equities

dcterms:description: The features (predictors) are summarized in Table 1, which includes various academic references for each predictor.
dcterms:title: Twelve attributes (predictors) for firms

dcterms:description: The Bloomberg fields are, in order, CUR_MKT_CAP, PX_TO_BOOK_RATIO, TOT_DEBT_TO_TOT_EQY, VOLATILITY_30D, PROF_MARGIN, ASSET_GROWTH, IS_EPS, PX_VOLUME, RSI_30D, PE_RATIO. The dividend yield is evaluated as EQY_DPS divided by the lagged value of the closing price field PX_LAST. Momentum is also computed via the closing price (lagged 12 month value divided by lagged one month value, minus one).
dcterms:title: Bloomberg fields for predictors

dcterms:description: The empirical analysis relies on historical stock returns data, which is not detailed in the references but is implied to be sourced from Bloomberg LP.
dcterms:title: Historical stock returns data
